net.sourceforge.gjtapi.raw
Interface CCTpi

All Known Subinterfaces:
FullJtapiTpi, TelephonyProvider
public interface CCTpi
extends BasicJtapiTpi

These are the methods required by TelephonyProviders that support call control for JTAPI Creation date: (2000-10-04 13:46:43)

                 java.lang.String address,

          throws RawStateException,
                 javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException,
                 javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                 javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Put a call identified by a terminal and connection on hold (CallControlTerminalConnection)
Parameters:
call - The call that we are holding on.
address - The address for the terminal that defines the call leg to hold
terminal - The terminal that we want to make on hold
Throws:
RawException - Some low-level exception occured.

join

public CallId join(CallId call1,
                   CallId call2,
                   java.lang.String address,
                   java.lang.String terminal)
            throws RawStateException,
                   javax.telephony.InvalidArgumentException,
                   javax.telephony.MethodNotSupportedException,
                   javax.telephony.PrivilegeViolationException,
                   javax.telephony.ResourceUnavailableException
Join one call to another call (Connection). If the address and terminal are not null, they should refer to a TerminalConnection on call1. For assisted transfer, this allows the joining of an on-hold call to an active call. Unassisted transfer and single-step transfer can be accomplished in the JTAPI layer by combining this call with a release() method call.
Parameters:
call1 - One call
call - Another call
address - An address that may be used for knitting the calls together, if necessary.
terminal - A terminal that may be used for knitting the calls together.
Returns:
The new call. This may be the same as one of the original calls.
Throws:
RawException - Some low-level state exception occured.
